description: Slack is a messaging platform for teams to communicate and collaborate.
name: slack
title: Slack

actions.description: Posts a message to a public channel, private channel, or existing direct message conversation.
actions.name: sendMessage

properties.description: The id of a channel where the message will be sent.
properties.name: channelId
properties.label: Channel

properties.description: One of these arguments is required to describe the content of the message. If attachments or blocks are included, text will be used as fallback text for notifications only.
properties.name: contentType
properties.label: Content type

options.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.
options.label: Attachments

options.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.
options.label: Blocks

options.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call.
options.label: Text

properties.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.
properties.name: attachments
properties.label: Attachments

properties.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.
properties.name: blocks
properties.label: Blocks

properties.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call.
properties.name: text
properties.label: Text

properties.description: (Legacy) Pass true to post the message as the authed user instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. Can only be used by classic Slack apps. See authorship below.
properties.name: asUser
properties.label: As user

properties.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides icon_url.
properties.name: iconEmoji
properties.label: Icon emoji

properties.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message.
properties.name: iconUrl
properties.label: Icon URL

properties.description: Find and link user groups. No longer supports linking individual users; use syntax shown in Mentioning Users instead.
properties.name: linkNames
properties.label: Link names

properties.description: JSON object with event_type and event_payload fields, presented as a URL-encoded string. Metadata you post to Slack is accessible to any app or user who is a member of that workspace.
properties.name: metadata
properties.label: Metadata

properties.description: Disable Slack markup parsing by setting to false. Enabled by default.
properties.name: mrkdwn
properties.label: Mrkdwn

properties.description: Change how messages are treated. See below.
properties.name: parse
properties.label: Parse

properties.description: Used in conjunction with thread_ts and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to false.
properties.name: replyBroadcast
properties.label: Reply broadcast

properties.description: Provide another message's ts value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's ts value; use its parent instead.
properties.name: threadTs
properties.label: Thread ts

properties.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.
properties.name: unfurlLinks
properties.label: Unfurl links

properties.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.
properties.name: unfurlMedia
properties.label: Unfurl media

properties.description: Set your bot's user name.
properties.name: username
properties.label: Username

actions.title: Send message

actions.description: Sends a direct message to another user in a workspace. If it hasn't already, a direct message conversation will be created.
actions.name: sendDirectMessage

properties.description: The id of a user to send the direct message to.
properties.name: userId
properties.label: User

properties.description: One of these arguments is required to describe the content of the message. If attachments or blocks are included, text will be used as fallback text for notifications only.
properties.name: contentType
properties.label: Content type

options.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.
options.label: Attachments

options.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.
options.label: Blocks

options.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call.
options.label: Text

properties.name: text
properties.label: Text

properties.label: As user

properties.label: Icon emoji

properties.name: iconUrl
properties.label: Icon URL

properties.name: linkNames
properties.label: Link names

properties.description: JSON object with event_type and event_payload fields, presented as a URL-encoded string. Metadata you post to Slack is accessible to any app or user who is a member of that workspace.
properties.name: metadata

properties.description: Disable Slack markup parsing by setting to false. Enabled by default.
properties.name: mrkdwn
properties.label: Mrkdwn

properties.name: parse
properties.label: Parse

properties.description: Used in conjunction with thread_ts and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to false.
properties.name: replyBroadcast
properties.label: Reply broadcast

properties.description: Provide another message's ts value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's ts value; use its parent instead.
properties.name: threadTs
properties.label: Thread ts

properties.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.
properties.name: unfurlLinks
properties.label: Unfurl links

properties.name: unfurlMedia
properties.label: Unfurl media
